headline: Devon Energy Merger With Coterra And Move To Houston Sparks Valuation Focus
summary: Devon Energy (NYSE:DVN) has agreed to an all stock merger with Coterra Energy valued at $58b. The combined company is set to become a large shale operator with a major presence in the Permian Basin. Devon plans to relocate its headquarters from Oklahoma City to Houston as part of the deal. The merger comes as Devon Energy trades at $44.96, with the share price up 25.9% over the past 30 days and 36.0% over the past year. Over a longer period, the stock shows a 168.1% return over five years,...

headline: Coterra Devon Merger Aims For Scale Synergies And Bigger Cash Returns
summary: Coterra Energy and Devon Energy have agreed to a $58b all stock merger to create one of the largest shale producers in the Permian Basin. The combined company plans a higher dividend and a sizable share repurchase program following completion of the deal. Both boards have unanimously approved the transaction, which is intended to create a larger, more efficient U.S. shale operator. Coterra Energy, NYSE:CTRA, comes into this merger with an active trading price of $31.65 and multi year...
